msDesc.head: 'Liber de miraculis BVM'; 'Oratio S. Edmundi Rich'

msItem.incipit: Liber de miraculis beate marie Virginis Prologus primus fol. 1r
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in miracula dei genitricis marie. fol. 2v
msItem.incipit: Celorum regine et terrarum imperatrici noui operis fabrica fol. 2v
msItem.rubric: De guidone starensi episcopo quod honoranda et diligenda sit mater sancte marie sancta anna R. fol. 3v
msItem.incipit: Contigit quodam tempore quod rex qui peruus dicebatur ultra fines ulterioris hispanie fol. 3v
msItem.rubric: De quadam sponsa que deprecabatur cotidie beatam mariam ut vindicaret se de quadam adultera viri sui. fol. 31r
msItem.incipit:
Fratres operamini
non potestatis metere fol. 31v
msItem.explicit:
Tibi lux et gloria
Per eterna secula
Amen dicant omnia. fol. 32r
msItem.title: Miracula Beatae Virginis Mariae.

note.p: Eighty-nine numbered and one (164a) unnumbered tales from the collection made in England between about 1100 and 1140 which is the foundation of most later collections. On its genesis and the basic sources for the study of it, see CR ii and R. W. Southern, 'The English Origins of the Miracles of the Virgin', Medieval and Renaissance Studies, 4 (1958), 176-216, also J. C. Jennings, 'The Origins of the 'Elements Series' of the Miracles of the Virgin', ibid. 6 (1968), 84-93. Identifications here are by page reference to CR ii ('CR') and where that fails by item number in A. Poncelet, 'Initia miraculorum Beatae Virginis Mariae', Analecta Bollandiana, 21 (1902), 241-360 ('P').
Marginalia in a hand of s. xv include corrections and 'nota' instructions

msItem.rubric: Deuota oratio quam sanctus Edmundus quondam scolaris istius vniuersitatis postea Archiepiscopus Cantuariensis frequenter solebat dicere ad beatissimam mariam virginem et sanctum Johannem Euangelistam. fol. 32r
msItem.incipit: O intemerata et in eternum benedicta singularis fol. 32r
msItem.explicit: Per omnia secula seculorum. Amen. fol. 32v
msItem.title: O intemerata

note.p: The prayer is older than St Edmund of Abingdon: see A. Wilmart, 'La Pri√®re O intemerata', Auteurs spirituels et textes devots du moyen age latin (Paris, 1932), 474-504, esp. 482 et seq. At 488-90 he edits the text from six manuscripts and several printed texts. Often printed elsewhere, e.g. PL 158. 959-60 (as a prayer of St Anselm).

In Narcissus Luttrell's hand on fol. 32r is a note on Edmund's consecration and that he was a student at University College, Oxford. The reference to the university in the rubric, from which Luttrell's note is derived, appears not to be found in other copies and suggests an Oxford origin for either this manuscript or the exemplar of this item. Added at the end of the capitula by Luttrell in imitation of a gothic text hand is Oratio sancti Edmundi Archiepiscopi Cant: ad Beatam Mariam Virginem et Sanctum Iohannem Evangelistam.

physDesc.p: Fore- and endleaves: fols. ir-iir blank; fol. iiir, title, pressmarks; fol. iiiv blank; fols. Ir-IIv, blank.

supportDesc.support: Written on 32 membrane leaves of average quality, some repaired with patches before writing, preceded by two modern paper flyleaves and one medieval flyleaf, and followed by two modern paper flyleaves. Fol. iii is a flyleaf (or perhaps cover) of very coarse membrane.

collation.p: No quire numbers or signatures. Catchwords in cartouches on fols. 12v and 24v.

layout.p: Pricked in outer margins and for verticals, ruled in crayon. Folded FSOS.

handDesc.handNote: The added prayer on fol. 32r is in a careful hybrida

binding.p: Sewn on five bands between millboards covered with buckram and bound in half-leather with leather cornerpieces (s. xixin). Rebacked. Repaired by Maltby June 1962 inside front cover.

origin.p: An Oxford connection (if not origin) may be indicated by the rubric of item 2.

history.provenance: Fol. 1r Nar. Luttrell His Book 1682: identifiable as no. 5 in the sale of Richard Smith's books in that year, sold to Luttrell for 3s. 4d.: see under MS 17 above. On the same leaf are some 16th-century pen-trials and on fol. iiir a title in capitals (s. xvii?), M:SS. Anonymi. Liber Miraculorum B. Marini Virgin(is).
history.acquisition: All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, inside the front cover, vv.3.11 (deleted), M.S. 22, and L.R. 1.d.14 (pencil); on fol. iiir, MS 22., vv.3.11 (deleted); on fol. iiiv, 103; on fol. 1r, 14.17 (pencil). At the top of fol. iv is 30 [...] sh(?) 2o

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.
